Key Match Events: Damian Lillard hit the go-ahead jump shot with 9.8 seconds left to give the Bucks the lead.
Donovan Mitchell came back on the other end to sink Milwaukee with his heart-dagging shot with 0.3 seconds remaining to get the 114-113 win.
Post-Match Reflections: Damian Lillard's 41-point effort was wasted on Saturday night after the Milwaukee Bucks suffered their fifth-straight defeat.
The Bucks will need to play much better if they want to get out of their losing streak.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cleveland Cavaliers came back to get the lead with three minutes left in the second period.
The Bucks were up 38-30 after one quarter but the Cavaliers came back to get the lead.
Others: Damian Lillard made five 3-point shots in the first period to guide the Milwaukee Bucks to an early lead.
The Bucks were seconds away from snapping their four-game skid.
